p: Ageratum conyzoides Linn commonly known as Billy goat weeds, belongs to Asteraceae family, an annual herb with a broad history of traditional medicinal use in the tropical and sub-tropical region of the world. Ageratum is derived from the Greek words ‘ageras’ meaning non-aging which refers to long life-time of plant and the species epithet ‘konyz’ is the Greek name of Inula helenium which resembles the plant. The stems and leaves of the plant are fully covered with fine white hairs ( Adewole, 2002).
